lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Shade_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/shadebot/Shade.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run shadebot.Shade.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

// Describe the action and its outcome.
// A description of the expected outcome goes here
* The main entry point for ShadeBot.
* Initializes the {@link TaskList} from persistent storage and
* starts the {@link Ui} for user interaction.
* Represents an abstract command that can be executed by ShadeBot.
* Each concrete command parses user-provided arguments and performs
* an operation on a {@link TaskList}, returning a user-facing response.
/** Raw arguments supplied to the command. */
* Constructs a command with the given argument string.
* @param args the arguments associated with this command
* Returns the raw argument string for this command.
* Adds a task to the provided task list and returns a formatted
* @param tasks the task list to add the task to
* @param t     the task to be added
protected String add(TaskList tasks, Task t) {
return("Got it. I've added this task:\n" +
"Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* Executes the command on the given task list.
* @param tasks the task list this command operates on
* @return a user-facing message describing the result of execution
* Represents a command that adds a deadline task to the task list.
* A deadline task consists of a description and a date/time by which
/** The deadline by which the task should be completed. */
* Constructs a {@code DeadlineCommand} with the given task description
* @param task the description of the task
* @param by   the deadline date and time
* Executes the command by creating a {@link DeadlineTask} and adding it
* @param tasks the task list to add the deadline task to
* Represents a command that deletes a task from the task list.
* The task to be deleted is specified by its one-based index as provided
* Constructs a {@code DeleteCommand} with the given argument string.
* @param args the one-based index of the task to delete
* Executes the command by removing the specified task from the task list.
* @param tasks the task list to remove the task from
"Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.";
* Represents a command that adds an event task to the task list.
/** Start date and time of the event. */
/** End date and time of the event. */
* Constructs an {@code EventCommand} with the given description and duration.
public EventCommand(String task, LocalDateTime from, LocalDateTime to) {
* Creates an event task and adds it to the task list.
* @param tasks task list to add the event to
* @return a confirmation message for the user
Task t = new EventTask(this.getArgs(), this.from, this.to);
* Represents a command that searches for tasks in a task list
* matching a given keyword or query string.
* The {@code FindCommand} filters tasks based on the provided arguments
* and returns a formatted list of matching tasks.
* Constructs a {@code FindCommand} with the specified search arguments.
* @param args the keyword or query string used to find matching tasks
* Executes the find command on the given task list.
* Matching tasks are numbered starting from 1 and returned as a
* @param tasks the task list to search within
* @return a formatted string containing all matching tasks
return "Here are the matching tasks in your list:" +
* Represents a command that lists all tasks in the task list.
* Constructs a {@code ListCommand} with no arguments.
* Executes the command by returning a formatted list of all tasks.
* @param tasks the task list to be listed
* @return a user-facing string containing all tasks
* Represents a command that marks or unmarks a task in the task list.
/** Whether the task should be marked as done or not done. */
* Constructs a {@code MarkCommand} with the given task index and action.
* @param args   one-based index of the task to mark or unmark
* @param isMark {@code true} to mark as done, {@code false} to mark as not done
* Executes the command by marking or unmarking the specified task.
* @param tasks the task list containing the task
? "Nice! I've marked this task as done:"
: "OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:")
* Represents a command that adds a todo task to the task list.
* Constructs a {@code TodoCommand} with the given task description.
* @param args the description of the todo task
* Executes the command by creating a {@link TodoTask} and adding it
* @param tasks the task list to add the todo task to
return("Got it. I've added this task:\n" +
"Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* Thrown to indicate that a command was invoked with insufficient arguments.
* Constructs an {@code InsufficientArgumentException} with the specified detail message.
* @param message the detail message explaining the missing or insufficient arguments
* Thrown to indicate that an unrecognized or unsupported command was encountered.
* Constructs an {@code UnknownCommandException} with the specified detail message.
* @param message the detail message explaining the unknown command
* Parses input strings of the form "description /by datetime" into a {@link DeadlineCommand}.

* @param inp the user input string in the format "description /by datetime"
* @return a {@link DeadlineCommand} representing the parsed task
* Default implementation of the {@link Parser} interface.
* Converts user input strings into corresponding {@link Command} objects.
* Supports commands like {@code mark}, {@code unmark}, {@code list}, {@code todo},
* Parses the input string and returns the corresponding {@link Command}.
* @param inp the raw user input string
* @return the {@link Command} corresponding to the input
throw new UnknownCommandException("OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
* Extracts the argument portion of a command input.
* @param inp the input split into words
* @return the argument string (everything after the command keyword)
throw new InsufficientArgumentException(String.format("Insufficient arguments provided for %s", inp[0]));
* Parses input strings of the form "description /from start_datetime /to end_datetime"
* Parses the input string into an {@link EventCommand}.
* @param inp the user input string in the format
* @return an {@link EventCommand} representing the parsed event task
* @throws ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException if the "/from" or "/to" delimiters are missing
* @throws RuntimeException if the datetime formats are invalid (via {@link Parser#parseDateTime})
* Represents a parser that converts user input strings into {@link Command} objects.
* Parses the given input string and returns the corresponding command.
* @return a {@link Command} object representing the user's command
/** Array of date-time formatters that include both date and time. */
/** Array of date-only formatters (time defaults to 00:00). */
* Parses a string into a {@link LocalDateTime} using predefined date or date-time formats.
* @param inp the input string representing a date or date-time
* @throws UnknownCommandException if the input cannot be parsed with any known format
throw new UnknownCommandException("Invalid datetime format. Try 31-01-2026 1400 or 31-01-2026");
* Default implementation of {@link Storage} using file-based serialization.
* Provides methods to save and load {@link Task} objects to a data file.
* Uses a singleton pattern to ensure only one storage instance exists.

* If the file does not exist, it is created and an empty list is returned.

System.err.println("Failed to read from data file: " + e.getMessage());
System.err.println("Skipped " + i + " tasks due to data corruption");
* Returns the singleton instance of {@link DefaultStorage} using the default file name.

* Subsequent calls will return the same instance regardless of the filename provided.

* @return formatted string representing the deadline task
* Represents a task that occurs over a specific time period.
* Extends {@link Task} and includes start and end date-times.

* @param from the start date and time of the event
* @param to   the end date and time of the event
public EventTask(String task, LocalDateTime from, LocalDateTime to) {
* Returns a string representation of the event task, including type,
* completion status, description, and formatted start and end times.

* Abstract base class representing a task in ShadeBot.
* Each task has a description and a completion status.
public abstract class Task implements Serializable {
/** Serial version UID for serialization compatibility. */

DATE_TIME_FORMATTER = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM d yyyy h:mma", Locale.ENGLISH);

* Returns a string representation of the task, including its status.
* @return a formatted string representing the task

* Two tasks are considered equal if their string representations are identical.
* @return {@code true} if the tasks are equal, {@code false} otherwise
* Represents a collection of {@link Task} objects.

/** The list of tasks managed by this TaskList. */

public Task mark(int idx, boolean isMark) {
